Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Landiolol for Tachyarrhythmias Management

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients with intraoperative tachyarrhythmias. This randomised controlled trial was conducted in Japan, with participants recruited from cardiac and non-cardiac surgery settings.

Intervention.evidence: Participants received either landiolol or a comparator Î²-blocker, esmolol, for heart rate control.

Objective.evidence: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of landiolol compared to esmolol in controlling heart rate.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was heart rate control within 24 hours post-intervention.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomised using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the landiolol group and 100 to the esmolol group, between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on 98 participants in the landiolol group and 97 in the esmolol group using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Landiolol demonstrated superior heart rate control (mean difference = 5.2 bpm, 95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild, with 3% in the landiolol group and 1% in the esmolol group experiencing mild gastrointestinal side-effects.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under number XYZ123.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by ABC Pharmaceuticals.
